title: Good complaint handling
desc:
Handled badly, complaints can be resource intensive and have financial and reputational consequences. Handled well, they offer a way to restore relationships with dissatisfied customers and provide a rich source of information to improve public service.

This e-learning, developed in partnership with the Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman, takes you through the steps involved in good complaint handling and includes numerous practical examples from operational delivery environments. It also covers how to identify a complaint and why customers complain.

outcomes.blurb: As a result of completing this learning opportunity you will be able to:
points: explain the importance of communicating with the customer in a way that best suits their needs
explain the importance of clarifying the complaint, maintaining communication and communicating the outcome effectively
understand the role of the Parliamentary and Heath Service Ombudsman
outcomes.warning: Please note that it may take up to 24 hours for your learning record to update following completion of this course.
